pages.text: Rhamphodopsis is a genus of small ptychodont placoderm from Scotland. Unlike other placoderms, who had thick cranial armor, Rhamphodopsis, alongside its relatives Campbellodus and Materpiscis had highly reduced cranial armor. The reason for this loss of armor is unknown.
Two species of Rhamphodopsis have been described. R. thrieplandi, who was much smaller and had shorter spikes, and R. trispinatus, which was much more robust and larger than its contemporary.
